shortcontents.shortcontent:
I)Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-138vb) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-104r) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 104r-115v) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 115v-122r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 122ra-132rb) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 132rb-136va) I-6) Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʿǝkt... “The angels praise Her...” (fols. 136va-138vb)
Additiones 1-3.

originlink.xlink:title: Kädiḥ Däbrä Täwaḥәdo Qәddәst Maryam / KTM

locationlink.xlink:title: Kädiḥ Däbrä Täwaḥәdo Qәddәst Maryam / KTM

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Maryam is metioned as the scribe in the concluding supplication formula on fol. 137vb.

donors.donor: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated by Gäbrä Täklä Haymanot Dәblәš. His name is also written (in vivid crimson) in the supplication formulas added later, in the same hand as Additio 2, into fols. 8v, 14v, 20v, 29v, 36v, 70v, 104r, 115v.

owners.owner: The original owner, Gäbrä Maryam, is mentioned in the concluding supplication formula on fol. 137vb.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with vegetal threads. The back board is missing and replaced with a piece of cardboard. The sewing is damaged and partly repaired. Fol. 138 is a loose leaf.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired; the back board is missing and replaced with a piece of cardboard). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – II(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 13r-22v) – III(10/fols. 23r-32v) – IV(10/fols. 33r-42v) – V(10/fols. 43r-52v) – VI(10/fols. 53r-62v) – VII(10/fols. 63r-72v) – VIII(10/fols. 73r-82v) – IX(10/fols. 83r-92v) – X(10/fols. 93r-102v) – XI(10/fols. 103r-112v) – XII(10/fols. 113r-122v) – XIII(10/fols. 123r-132v) – XIV(5; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 133r-137v) - B(1/fol. 138).

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5, I-6: all data are for fol. 123r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5, I-6, name of the Archangel Gabriel in Texts I-4 to I-6); name of the owner and the scribe; titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; titles of Texts I-2, I-3, I-5 and I-6; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-4; name and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; initial word or abbreviation of refrains of Texts I-4 and I-5; a few words in Text I-5; elements of the punctuation signs.
A few group of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Texts I-1, I-3, I-4 and on fol. 36v.

abbreviations.abbreviation: እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 94v-95r) ስቡ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fols. 111r-112v) Text I-4 ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 122rb-123ra) እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 123rb-124va) ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 125ra-126ra) ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 126vb-128va) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fol. 129ra-va) ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 130ra-131ra) ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 131va-132rb)

additional.cont: Fols. 1v-2r: Directives to the ministers concerning liturgical readings during feasts.
additional.det: The note is written partly in Amharic, in the same hand as Additio 3. Some passages are hardly legible due to faded ink. It is most probably an excerpt from an unidentified lectionary book (s. also Additio 3).

additional.cont: Fol. 138vb: Donation note.
additional.det: The note mentions the name of the donor, Täklä Haymanot Dǝlbǝš (?), and the name of the church, Maryam Kädih, to which the Ms. was donated. It is written in the same hand as the supplication formulas added later into some fols.

additional.cont: Fol. 138r-v: Directives to the ministers concerning blessing prayers.
additional.det: The note is written partly in Amharic, in the same hand as Additio 1. The text written on fol. 138v is hardly legible due to faded ink.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten by means of an ornamental band or a line of red and black dots. - Text I-3 contains interlineal musical signs. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 4v, 10r, 18r, 25v, 31v, 39r, 48r, 63r, 80v, 96v, 110v, 116r, 118r. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 16r, 26r. Omitted words are written interlineally: fols. 5r, 12r, 111v, 137rb. - Erasure marked with thin lines: fol. 70v. - Crude notes, doodles: fols. 1rv, 2r, 15v, 137v, inner side of the back board.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The name of the day of the week, ዘእሁድ, crudely written in the outer margin: fol. 104v.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces, antropomorphic motif. Fol. 8v: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 14v: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; geometric motif. Fol. 36v: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces. 5) Fol. 49r: double coloured (black, red) ornamental band; geometric motifs. 6) Fol. 70v: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces. 7) Fol. 104r: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces. 8) Fol. 115v: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces. 9) Fol. 122r: simple coloured (black, red) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motif.
